div.p: AM. EX. F.
J L Dodds
Comp L 23rd Engrs
Miss Ellen Smith
111 Hatton Street
Jackson
Tennessee
U.S.A.
Bruilly France
April 13-1919
Dear Ellen:
I received a letter from you this last week and of course you know I was real glad to hear from you. I get so few letters from you these days.
I believe you do hate to write now you must be real sweet and write me real often and maybe I will get home some of these days
Then you wont have to write any more for I am never going to get this far from home any more. Do you blame me Yes I know Lin is getting impatient to get home and
he is not alone. If I dont get home before long will have to have a fueled sell ready for me in Boliuer
I wrote Lin short letter to day asking him what he is doing and when he expected to start home. We might get home about the same time
Of course I havent the least idea when I will get to come back.
And I guess I wont know a thing about starting until we are ready to move out
Some say we will leave this camp some time this month.
But we will go where there is some work to be done near Le Mans.
I know you was glad to see Harold come back I bet he makes you step around since he is such a big man
This Army life is great if a fellow can stand it I know he was glad to get home and get some good cooking
The way they cook in the Army every thing start just alike whether it is beans or meat.
Well I have lost that job I was telling about last Sunday (K P) you ask Harold he can tell you how it goes
I will be out on truck next week.
I say the Elks did have some minstral from the way the program looks wish I could have been there Of course Bond Wilkerson would have to do some thing.
They must have made some big money out of it if they had three big nights Yes Lin and myself were talking about the dance we knew they would have on St. Patrick day.
I know I will be to late to get in in any of the dances until next winter.
I will say that was some rain you had every one that writes to any of us has something to say about it
Yes I remember where we went to see the dredge
That brings back old memories did you ever think about that being the first night I ever made a date with you
The beginning of some happy hours I have spent Only to have them stoped all of a sudden about 18 months later No I never will forget that time.
Well dear is most supper time and I am going to have some good old Army beans Can't miss them
With lots of love
Fayette
